fields.name: Entropy
fields.description: A measure of the number of specific ways in which a thermodynamic system may be arranged, often taken to be a measure of disorder, or a measure of progressing towards thermodynamic equilibrium.

fields.name: Exergy
fields.description: Total enthalpy in a closed system, excluding entropy

fields.name: Emergy
fields.description: Total enthalpy in an open system, excluding entropy

fields.name: Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Products that use doped silicon to generate solar electricity

fields.name: Monocrystalline Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Monocrystalline silicon is a form in which the crystal structure is homogenous throughout the material, the orientation, lattice parameter, and electronic properties are constant throughout the material.

fields.name: Polycrystalline Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Polycrystalline silicon is composed of many smaller silicon grains of varied crystallographic orientation. This material can be synthesized easily by allowing liquid silicon to cool using a seed crystal of the desired crystal structure. Additionally, other methods for crystallizing amorphous silicon to form polysilicon exist such as high temperature chemical vapor deposition (CVD).

fields.name: Monocrystalline Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Monocrystalline silicon is a form in which the crystal structure is homogenous throughout the material, the orientation, lattice parameter, and electronic properties are constant throughout the material.

fields.name: Polycrystalline Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Polycrystalline silicon is composed of many smaller silicon grains of varied crystallographic orientation. This material can be synthesized easily by allowing liquid silicon to cool using a seed crystal of the desired crystal structure. Additionally, other methods for crystallizing amorphous silicon to form polysilicon exist such as high temperature chemical vapor deposition (CVD).

fields.name: Amorphous Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Amorphous silicon has no long-range periodic order. The application of amorphous silicon to photovoltaics as a standalone material is somewhat limited by its inferior electronic properties.

fields.name: Amorphous Silicon Photovoltaics
fields.description: Amorphous silicon has no long-range periodic order. The application of amorphous silicon to photovoltaics as a standalone material is somewhat limited by its inferior electronic properties.

fields.name: Luminescent Solar Concentrators
fields.description: Solar concentrators that absorb light and re-emit it in a different spectrum

fields.name: Dye-Sensitized Photovoltaics
fields.description: Dye-sensitized solar cells separate the two functions provided by silicon in a traditional cell design. Normally the silicon acts as both the source of photoelectrons, as well as providing the electric field to separate the charges and create a current. In the dye-sensitized solar cell,  the bulk of the semiconductor is used solely for charge transport, the photoelectrons are provided from a separate photosensitive dye. Charge separation occurs at the surfaces between the dye, semiconductor and electrolyte.

fields.name: Plasmonic Photovoltaics
fields.description: Plasmonic solar cells (PSC) are a class of photovoltaic devices that convert light into electricity by using plasmons. PSCs are a type of thin-film SC which are typically 1-2um thick. They can use substrates which are cheaper than silicon
